p:
An initial susceptible pool of hosts ( S) transfers to a state of primary infection ( I
A or I
B ), as individuals are bitten by a mosquito infected with the respective serotype. Eventually, they recover from this primary infection, entering a brief period of cross-immunity ( R
A or R
B ). While remaining immune to the primary serotype they were infected with, hosts then enter a state of susceptibility to a secondary infection (
S
A
2
or
S
B
2
). They may then be bitten and infected with the other serotype (
I
A
2
or
I
B
2
), before eventually recovering again into a period of complete recovery ( R).
